name: Cooking Light's Pork Medallions with Port Wine-Dried Cherry Pan Sauce
description: This recipe for Pork Medallions with Port Wine-Dried Cherry Pan Sauce is a warm, rich wintry dish that treats pork tenderloin the way it wants to be treated; cut into rounds and seared to retain plenty of juiciness and porky flavor. It comes together in a half hour.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup ruby port or other sweet red wine

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large skillet over low heat 2 minutes. Cut pork crosswise into 16 pieces. Sprinkle evenly with salt and pepper.

Place pork in pan; cook 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove pork from pan. Stir in wine mixture, scraping to loosen browned bits. Increase heat to high; bring to a boil. Cook until reduced to 1/2 cup (about 3 minutes). Remove from heat. Stir in butter with a whisk. Serve sauce over pork. Garnish with parsley, if desired.
